decision_conditions: The proposal has failed to demonstrate that it will safeguard the protection and long-term retention of the existing street trees, which contribute positively to the local landscape character of the area. The proposal would, thus, result in harm to and potential loss of the public trees contrary to Chapter 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies G1 and G7 of the London Plan (2021), Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (2012), and Policies DMHB 11, DMHB 12, and DMHB 14 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two- Development Management Policies (2020).

The proposal, by reason of the loss of the public grass verge, public trees, and front boundary wall and the addition of hard landscaping to the front garden, would be detrimental to the visual amenity and character of the street scene. The proposal is thus, contrary to Chapter 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies D3, G1, and G7 of the London Plan (2021), Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (2012), Policies DMT 1, DMT2, DMHB 11, DMHB 12, DMHB 14, and DMHB 18 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020), and the Council's 'Domestic Vehicle Footway Crossover' Policy (2022).
